text:
Question 168) Absolute density (D) is the reason between the mass of a body and the volume occupied by it. One teacher proposed to his class for students to analyze the density of three bodies: DA, DB, DC. The students found that the body A had 1.5 time the mass of body B and this, in turn, had 3 4 of body mass C. They also observed that the volume of the body A was the same as the body B and 20% higher than body volume C.
After the analysis, the students correctly ordered the densities of these bodies in the following way
A) DB <DC
B) db = from <dc
C) dc <db = da
D) db <dc <
E) dc <db <da
